703015f-a.text:
Atlantic Ave., at the N.E. corner of Clinton Street showing the Brooklyn Athenaeum designed by William Field and erected at a cost of $60,000. The first floor was for commercial enterprises; the second for reading and for private rooms, the third floor had a concert hall capable of seating 2000 people. It gave the first Italian Opera in 1858. The Philharmonic Society held its first concert here. The Reading Room was opened to the public on May 7, 1858. The Mercantile Library was here but later moved to Montague Street. John Homsey purchased it in 1922.  In 1929 it housed the Court of Special Sessions.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703015f-a.folder: Atlantic Avenue & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY

703674f-a.text:
Clinton Street, west side, at and north of Atlantic Ave., showing in the foreground the United States Apartments, built in 1882 by E. Fougera Sr., on the site of a drug store he had opened in 1862.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703674f-a.folder: Clinton Street & Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703675f-a.text:
Clinton Street, at, adjoining and south of Atlantic Ave., showing the corner building which was the home of the South Brooklyn Savings Bank until 1922. The bank was incorporated in 1850 and at that time was at 160 Atlantic Ave.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
703675f-a.folder: Clinton Street & Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703016f-a.text:
167 Atlantic Ave., a the N.W. corner of Clinton Street. A view of the first large apartment house in Brooklyn.
June 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
703016f-a.folder: Atlantic Avenue & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY

703017f-a.text:
Atlantic Ave., at the S.E. corner of Clinton Street. A view of the original home of the South Brooklyn Savings Institution.
June 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
703017f-a.folder: Atlantic Avenue & Clinton Street, Brooklyn, NY

703670f-a.text:
Clinton Street, east side, from and including Atlantic Ave., to and including State Street. This is a view of the N.E. corner of Atlantic Ave., and Clinton Street, showing the old Brooklyn Athenaeum, famous in the 70's and 80's as an auditorium. Later used as a Court Room.
June 11, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
703670f-a.folder: Clinton Street & Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703671f-a.text:
173-177 Clinton Street, at the N.E. corner of Atlantic Ave. No. 177 at the corner, was occupied prior to 1932, as the Court of Special Sessions. Also seen is Atlantic Ave., north side, east from Clinton Street.
April 29, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
703671f-a.folder: Clinton Street & Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703673f-b.text:
(1)
Clinton Street, north from Atlantic Ave., showing at the left, the site upon which was the U.S. Apartments. Also seen is the 12-story Insurance Building in the background.
April 29, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing also State Street, at, adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Clinton Street.
April 29, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
703673f-b.folder: Clinton Street & Atlantic Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703666f-a.text:
Clinton Street, east side, north from Atlantic Ave., to Schermerhorn Street. Also shown is several Brooklyn Skyscrapers located on the west side of Court Street.
April 29, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
